property.name: description
property.value:
On this settings page you can enable and configure the statistics collection module. You can configure the folowwing settings: connection to Elasticsearch, Kibana preconfigured settings and GeoLocation transformation.

You need to have access to an Elasticsearch setup in order to store the collected data about the incoming requests of the client, exceptions and messages and interesting metrics of the response messages. These settings will be change on the next webapplication startup.
The Kibana server can connect to the Elasticsearch setup and visualize the innformation.

property.name: title
property.value: All: Enable statistics collection?

property.name: description
property.value: Enable the statistics module. If unchecked all the below fields won't be processed.

property.name: title
property.value: Elasticsearch: Connection mode

property.name: description
property.value:
Connection mode to the Elasticsearch cluster. The 'Node client' and the 'Transport client' connects to an external Elasticsearch server. The 'Embedded Server' mode starts a local elasticsearch server which stores the data in the WEB-INF/elasticsearch directory it is recommended only for testing purposes (some preconfigured visualizations are not available with embedded server).
For more information between Node and TransportClient mode visit the official website

property.name: title
property.value: Elasticsearch: Cluster name

property.name: description
property.value: Where to store your data. About the Elasticsearch terminology

property.name: title
property.value: Elasticsearch: Address(es) of the cluster

property.name: description
property.value:
It requires a comma seperated list of hosts to use that will act as gossip routers to connect to the cluster. Beware of the port number it MUST be the node-to-node (9300) communication port NOT the HTTP traffic port (9200). The port number can be omitted the defaults will be used.
Examples 1: localhost:9300 Example2: masternode1,masternode2:12345

property.name: title
property.value: Elasticsearch: index name

property.name: description
property.value: Where to store your data. About the Elasticsearch terminology

property.name: title
property.value: Elasticsearch: type name

property.name: description
property.value: Where to store your precious data. About the Elasticsearch terminology

property.name: title
property.value: Elasticsearch: Unique id of your statistics collections

property.name: description
property.value: If you leave it empty we will generate a new one for you

property.name: title
property.value: Kibana: Install preconfigured Kibana dashboards/visualizations

property.name: description
property.value: If this checkbox is enabled the preconfigured Kibana settings, visualizations and dashboards will be installed. The .kibana index will be deleted in Elasticsearch before the import. If you point your Kibana instance to this Elasticsearch cluster you can use our deployed configurations. The statistics collection MUST be enabled.

property.name: title
property.value: Kibana: external preconfigured dashboards/visualization

property.name: description
property.value: Absolute path to the Kibana configuration file which contains some predefined visualizations and dashboard. If you leave this field blank we import the default settings which came with this server deployment.

property.name: title
property.value: GeoLocation: Enable geolocation

property.name: description
property.value: These settings below are for transforming the client's IP address to geolocation format. This feature use an external database from company Maxmind. These databases comes in two flavor 'City' and 'Country' they differ in accuracy and size. These settings will be change on the next webapplication startup. This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from http://www.maxmind.com.

property.name: title
property.value: GeoLocation: Downloading type

property.name: description
property.value: If you choose 'AUTO' you MUST Specify the 'Download directory' path. BY 'MANUAL' downloding you MUST point to the extracted database full path location. If you choose 'AUTO' and the 'geolocation transformation' is enabled the databases will be downloaded at the next application startup.

property.name: title
property.value: GeoLocation: Download directory

property.name: description
property.value: If you choose 'AUTO' download this property MUST be specified. Absolute address is needed. The databases will be downloaded to this location so the server must be able to write at this location.

property.name: title
property.value: GeoLocation: City location

property.name: description
property.value: If you choose 'MANUAL' download and the 'GeoLocation database type' is CITY you MUST specify this property. The absolute path of the database is needed.

property.name: title
property.value: GeoLocation: Country location

property.name: description
property.value: If you choose 'MANUAL' download and the 'GeoLocation database type' is COUNTRY you MUST specify this property. The absolute path of the database is needed.

property.name: title
property.value: GeoLocation: GeoLocation database type

property.name: description
property.value: Which database should be used.
